title: Ann Peebles - I Can't Stand The Rain(1974) - [Flac]{24bit 96khz
description:
This wonderful album, originally released in 1974 on the Memphis-based Hi Records label, deserved a wider audience than it ended up getting at the time. It played to Ann PeeblesÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ great strength, her poised and sultry voice, and surrounded by the sparse, easy funkiness of the trademark Hi rhythm section and producer Willie MitchellÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s perfect use of horns and strings, she sings like a resilient but disappointed angel on this impressive set of songs about the darker side of love. Her best song is here, the eccentric but brilliant "I CanÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t Stand the Rain," along with a marvellous version of Joe SimonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s "(You Keep Me) HanginÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ On," and perfect readings of a pair of Earl Randle songs, "If We CanÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t Trust Each Other" and "IÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m Gonna Tear Your Playhouse Down." Peebles sings her heart out, and with those somehow bright-sounding Hi grooves behind her, it all comes together to make a classic album of dark, bouncy, and beautiful Southern soul. Steve Leggett, Allmusic.
